intro: Agatea lecointei, commonly known as the Madagascar agatea, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the island of Madagascar. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves and striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Its conservation status is critically endangered due to habitat loss and over-collection. Agatea lecointei is of significant botanical interest due to its distinct morphology and limited distribution.
